info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 12:47PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Showers and few weak thunderstorms developing over Judith Basin and Fergus Counties early this afternoon may briefly produce cold air funnel clouds... At 1241 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and possible weak thunderstorms developing across eastern portions of central Montana. Isolated lightning and very small hail are possible with the strongest cells through 3 pm this afternoon. The location of these cells near an upper level low pressure system centered near the area could lead to a few weak cold air funnel clouds spotted near cloud bases early this afternoon. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Stanford, Denton, Hobson, Winifred, Moore, Grass Range, Geyser, Roy, Fergus, Windham, Forestgrove, Sapphire Village, Utica, Danvers, Valentine, Hilger, Buffalo, Moccasin and Fred Robinson Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
